thanks for the info

itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:          Hi Rees. Try these settings with the Speak Jet Allophones file and ask for Arthur. :0)

Segments: USE CUE LIST / Z-CROSS (both check marked)
Play EVP: CONTINUOUSLY
Speed Control: 106%

It takes some practice getting used to picking out the words, but since you are already 
experienced with radio sweep, I'm thinking you'll get the hang of it right away. 

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks Stefan, I appreciate it. Also tonight I haven't had much luck with my RS 469. I 
going to give the EVPm a shot again. If you have any pointers please let me know?
> I haven't had much time to play with it.
> 
> Thanks
> 
> Rees
> 
> Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote: 
> Hi Rees,
> 
> your question isn't stupid - and you're not the only one who asked it. ;)
> 
> You need the QuickTime Player to watch Frank's cellphone videos.
> 
> Stefan
> 
> -- 
> 
> > Frank
> 
> > This is probably a stupid question, what type of program can I use to open this file?
> 
> > Thanks
> > Rees
> 
> > Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> > I mounted the '469 guts on a board, and added a 3 volt regulator to run the RS radio 
off the 12 volt supply. I have the sweep working so far, hopefully tomorrow I can test the 
radio with
> > external sweep to see if it actually works. The frequency display is now useless, so it's 
face down, and the power and band buttons will be added to a new front panel. I'm not 
sure if I want to
> > make this direct out, or make it just like any other box. The audio should be more 
better than anything I've done so for, at least it sounded real good when I was using a 
manual control, but only
> > could tune half the AM or FM bands wihtout the negative tuning voltage component. 
> 
> > The radio playing in the background is just C2C on a regular radio. 
> 
> > Frank-S
